Reviews.Title: “waste of money!”
Reviews.Author: emilia g Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: What to say about Hotel Romulus? The worst location ever! We were coming back from the city centre late at night and even though I'm not a person who gets easly scared, I was constantly looking over my shoulder. We were told there was a swimming pool and yes, there was... big, inflamable, empty paddling pool, hidden behind the scaffolding, that we couldn't access. Massive dissapointment, hence that was the reason why we've choosen this hotel! Massive mould in the shover didn't make me want to jump in and refresh after sleepless night ,due to the fact that another guest, next room decided to watch TV untill 2am. Being woken up at around 6am by other hotel guests and screeming children, is not the best start of the day but you could hope that the breakfast might make it all up for it. Not in this case! The choice of breakfast was between a dry bread roll or cheap cereals, no scramblled egg or at least a fresh fruit. We had to buy our own food and eat on the bed in our room! The only good word I've got to say is about the staff working behind the desk. They were very friendly and helpful. All and all - waste of money!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible location hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Zivile R Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel would be perfect if it have good location. But now this hotel is very far from the centre and there near the bus stop always (day or night) are "working" prostitutes (i don't know, maybe for some it's the advantage of hotel:D). I do not recommend this hotel for my friends.

Reviews.Title: “horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Lilian D
Reviews.Content: We had a bad experience staying at this hotel. The bus stop was near some prostitutes and it took us more than 1 hour to get to Rome each day (1 way). The breakfast was okay. We met some friends in Rome who showed us other hotels near for about the same price. Please do not go to this hotel. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Please stay away from this motel”
Reviews.Author: John R
Reviews.Content: This place was so far from Rome (sometimes it took me an hour to get to Rome). I also took the bus and found many pickpockets checking purses. You can see the prostitutes waiting for clients in front of the hotel....(you can imagine...). It was my first trip to Rome and I had to come to this terrible "hotel" The front desk staff was extremely impolite. I feel so bad I spent my money here.....stay away please.....

Reviews.Title: “so far!!”
Reviews.Author: Gigi C
Reviews.Content: I wish I would have read that part that said that the hotel was far from the city...I guess I missed it but the hotel is about an hour away from the city which is obviously the biggest inconvenience. I was very concerned after reading the reviews about how the breakfast was bad and noise from the highway but it was just not true. The breakfast was very good a lot of variety. Loved the pinapple juice :) The staff was ok not too friendly but certainly not rude. Yes the rooms are a little outdated but what we really liked was the bathroom because it was very clean. The noise from the highway was defenitely not a problem. Yes we did see the prostitutes which was fun lol but who cares about them they don't bother anyone. The shuttle service is a joke to me really why take me to a station when I still have to get to another station to go to main terminal it just didn't make much sense. Don't expect to watch too much television as there were no english channels :( But overall the stay is ok it's good for the price. But it's best if you spend the little extra money and stay somewhere a little closer to the main terminal at least.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this dump like you'd avoid the plague!”
Reviews.Author: tommyzz
Reviews.Content: No one in their right mind with any modicum of decency would rate this 'motel' above terrible. It's really a cheap stop off joint on the highway heading out of Rome or a bed for a few hours to shag one of the prostitutes who sell their wares less than 50m away at the overhead pass. You can't miss them if you're waiting for the bus. Reasonable price doesn't have to mean: Breakfast that's stale bread, bad cereal and juice and coffee from a machine; Bathrooms with a constant odor and/or disinfectant that's so strong that you have to leave the room; A frigobar that doesn't work; A restaurant (very salty food) with a set menu for 18Euros and by the way, it's closed on Sundays; A motel (oops, they call it a hotel) that's totally isolated - no restaurants, bars, supermarkets, fastfoods or convenience stores in proximity (what you saved in room cost you'll spend in taxi fares trying to find something decent to eat at night). Anything contrary to a terrible review was probably manipulated. Spend the extra money and stay within the circle (Central Rome).

Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ann b
Reviews.Content: "mafia-guy" on reception very old furniture and rooms

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: carolynseymour
Reviews.Content: My husband and I with two friends booked the Hotel Romulus ,I knew it was a short distance from central Rome , it was stated on the web site, after booking I looked on trip advisor, I was horrified at a lot of the reviews, I would still have to pay if I cancelled. On arrival we thought we were at the wrong hotel,true it is on a busy road but most hotels are, it was very clean , smart , very attentive staff and a very clean bedroom en-suite. We had a meal in the restaurant , a bit falty towerish but the food was good , it was exceptionally busy as the buses were on strike for the day. Breakfast was exactly what we were hoping for , fresh couissants, coffee , fresh juices , many other things should you want them. Prositutes were a long way from the hotel and certainly a very sad sight , , we were not affected in any way only to feel sympathy.I never saw any condoms , maybe some people spend their holiday looking for them!!! Hotel Romulus is an inexspensive Hotel and you get what they state.I am so sorry that people find it nessesary to write such bad reviews

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Romulus - What do people want for the price?”
Reviews.Author: benfromuk
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family for 2 nights - yes, it's little out of central Rome but you can see that from the map. The bus took about 20 minutes to get into Rome - the hour by someone is exaggerated. Prostitutes? Show me a city in where ther are none - they added colour to the industrial place where hotel is situated. As for the hotel - clean and efficient. Lionel was always very helpful. He even ordered food for us from locally late in the evening!! Ok, you may not like the furnishings and fittings but for the price it was very good. The bedding was clean and smelt fresh - the staff were helpful for extra towels/shampoo etc. The breakfast was great - the kids loved it. Great hotel for the price - will stay again - no complaints. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “Ou est le swimming pool?”
Reviews.Author: Raf S
Reviews.Content: We arrived, warned by other reviews about how far it is from the city centre, how noisy it gets at night with the highway (?) next to the hotel and how unsafe the neighbourhood is. We didn't have any problems with that. OK, you could see the pile of used condoms on the bridge over the highway getting bigger every morning and/or evening but you get used to it. There's a really good bus connection to the hotel from the metro/train station Tiburtina, so you can arrive in +- 25 minutes in the hotel. OK, the people on the bus are most of the time gypsy's, begging or smelling (also in the morning, soap allergy maybe?) but you don't feel that unsafe. OK, we were exhausted every evening because of the walking and city tripping and maybe we didn't get awoken by the traffic thanks to that. Although we slept right next to the highway. But we think it's a good hotel for budget travellers. We liked it because it had value for money. The staff was weird, sometimes nice, sometimes not so nice, but OK. Internet in the lobby was free. The rooms were really big, bathroom was really clean and had a good shower. OK, breakfast gets boring after 3 times the same things, no yoghurt's, no fruits, but it was basic. Only they put lemon on top of or in almost everything. Bah! But the only thing we wanted, was a nice swim in the swimming pool every evening after a long hot day, but it was broken. We asked every evening if it was fixed, but always the same negative answer. OK, we knew every evening when we arrived that they hadn't worked on it, but it was fun asking and always getting the same answer. For one thing we have to warn every future visitor: on the website it says that there's a free shuttle from the hotel to Tiburtina station. This is not correct. This is only for the weekends. In the week they drop you off at Fidene station. We did this one time and it took us 1h (!!!!) to get to Tiburtina. You better take the bus! But we stayed here one week and it was cheap, so the hotel is OK.

Reviews.Title: “plus and minus”
Reviews.Author: jcampbell34761
Reviews.Content: If you are low maintenance and just need a clean place to stay this is your hotel. Located so far from city center our driver had to charge extra. Staff was a mixture of Super friendly and staff from hell.. Make sure you have Euro cash when checking out because they need the city tax paid in Euro cash and will get loud with you about it. I'm used to being friendly to my customers and being treated the same so this place was an eye opener for me. the restaurant staff was a little rude to some of our party. I live in Orlando and expext disney treatment but it took me a little while to realize ther was no Mickey here.

Reviews.Title: “hotel romulus”
Reviews.Author: k0ky
Reviews.Content: We received a friendly welcome and good tourist advice.The staff speak good english. Don't be deterred by outward appearance of the building housing the hotel. the interior is fine. Although the room was not overlange, it was confortable and well laid out. the internet service worked and the food. (we han breakfast and dinner).

Reviews.Title: “Non serious dealing during reservation”
Reviews.Author: Petr_11
Reviews.Content: We did not stay at this hotel and the review is based only from bad feelings from reservation process. We made a reservation direct from their websites as it is cheaper than e.g on booking.com and provided a credit card info. In few days we have obtained an email that our card is invalid (is valid for sure) and they asked for another card by unsecured e-mail. We send them another card info (by secured way) and again few days later they asked for another credit card info and additionally the price was higher than on reservation. Why they ask for 3 credit card details? Moreover when we decided to pay cash on arrival? Reservation was cancelled. They have a lot of points to improve. Enjoy Rome

Reviews.Title: “Its a good hotel at a low price”
Reviews.Author: Kamil79
Reviews.Content: Good value,. Had a fridge (in one room) and hairdryers which is not standard in Europe and didn't think it would based on the price we paid. But its quite far. Wish it was easily accessable inspite of the bus service. It takes about 30 min by bus/metro to get there. It is good for people who are travelling alone for business purpose. The american breakfast is really good.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Rokonela
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very charm full and clean. + the room + the bathroom + comfortable + fridge in the room + free internet (in the lobby) - the breakfast (not too many things to choose from but great croissants although) - location (not the fact that it was 30 min away from the town center but the problem was that the bus was full of gypsies). Be careful in the bus.

Reviews.Title: “Bad and shady location...stay away”
Reviews.Author: AndreaB134438
Reviews.Content: I did not like this hotel......I was so disappointing and getting to Rome from the Hotel was a nightmare......I can't believe it has good reviews...with the same money you can find nice and better hotels near the metro stations......the bus take 30 mins to get to the metro station and there are many pick pockets in the bus.....be careful with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel....very far from Rome...bad area to stay.....”
Reviews.Author: TravelerKathy
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we should research more about this hotel....there are much nicer and better hotels for the same price near Rome and the airport.....it was a nightmare....We had to take the bus to the hotel and wait for almost and hour until the bus got there...once in the bus you have to take the metro to go anywhere in Rome....... Near the hotel there are many prostitutes standing under the bridge where your take the bus.....the staff in the hotel was kind of rude....the internet did not work like they promised.............the worst problem was the far away distance from Rome..as I mentioned before....there are much better hotels near Rome for the same price.... Rome is a nice place to see if you stay near the colosseum, the vatican or any of the areas near the metro.......there is not a metro stop near Hotel Romulus....

Reviews.Title: “romulus in rome”
Reviews.Author: ikuropka
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful, serviceminded and informative. The hotel was clean, the room confortable and clean also, with bathroom equiped with everything necessary. The air conditioning was also very usefull in the hot mediterran summer :) We had just breakfast, but it was delicious, we could choose from several tasteful food. It worth to book the room with breakfast included. It’s true it was a bit far from the city center, but with bus and subway maximum a half an our travell. (Our note: From Fiumicino it's recommended to travel to Tiburtina railway station with train, and then by Bus Nr. 135.)

Reviews.Title: “I recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: bored_stiff
Reviews.Content: This hotel, though it's located a little far away from the city centre, is worth recommending. The bus stop is about 20 metres from the hotel, the staff is nice, the rooms are comfortable, and breakfast is delicious:)

Reviews.Title: “It was not that great”
Reviews.Author: Shyamali-Hasalaka
Reviews.Content: We did not enjoy the stay. It was ver far from main tourist places and hotel was not great at all. Very old and I did not feel' clean' . The reality is different to the pictures you see

Reviews.Title: “Italian reality”
Reviews.Author: rbbrno
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome for 3 nights. We were looking forward to this famous city and according to the reviews, to a good hotel. We were very happy when we arrived at the hotel after very long journey with the underground and bus. We didn´t expect that we would go to the hotel with the public transport from Termini station for almost 2 hours. We were waiting for more than one hour for the bus 135 (this bus should go every 20 minutes from Monday to Friday, at weekends every 30-40 minutes). Check in went quickly. We had booked a double room with full breakfast. The receptionist told us that we didn´t have breakfast. And that it was not possible that we had booked breakfast with this type of room. I showed her a printed booking certificate in there was the payment including the breakfest. After 15 minutes we have got an answer that we will have breakfest. Not full, only the Italian one. The Italian breakfest consists of brioche, coffee, tea and some cakes... I felt hungry and ickie every day after this breakfest. The other "normal" breakfest costs 10 euro/person extra. This hotel also offers "free shuttle service". Our experience with this free shutle service was unbelievable... 1) we had booked the shuttle for Saturday 10am (around 18pm on friday) 2) after 22:00 the receptionist phoned us and told us that the shuttle for tomorrow was full and that we would book for another shuttle for 11am I went downstairs. I told her that we would like to book shuttle for sunday for 9:30. I saw her to write our room on the paper for the shuttle service 3) I wanted to be sure that we would go with a shuttle to Rome, so I asked on Saturday morning if we really booked it. The receptionist answered: "The shuttle is full and your room number is not there". I asked her how was that possible...I saw her to write it there. She showed me the paper and our room was not there. I couldnt believe it! Do they have one paper for some guests, for the others another one? After this 3rd experience we decided not to use any other service in this hotel. We just slept there... Our room was situated to the other site (not to the main street), we didnt hear the noise from the street. Summary: rooms and the bathroom spacious and clean enough, very far from the city center on a main street with very unregular bus service, poor and expensive breakfest, polite receptionist with a bad habbit. I cannot recommend this hotel. I have passed nights in different hotels and Im sure that in Rome you can find better hotels for same price.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: IlzeB
Reviews.Content: Far from centre, very used hotel where instatnt coffe is served in the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and clean but bad location”
Reviews.Author: Nikatika
Reviews.Content: Hotel is cheap, rooms are nice and clean, even small bathtubs in there. You can use wifi but you have to get a new code to enter the internet everyday. The hotel has a tiny bar, where they stop serving alcohol after 10:30 or 11:00pm, which makes it hard to get drunk =), because there is absolutely NOTHING in the neighbourhood where you can get another drink. The nearest supermarket is at 15 minutes driving distance and the city center takes more than 20 minutes, you need the bus and subway. The 15 year old girls selling out their bodies are nearby though, just across the hotel's parking lot. I would recommend the hotel itself, but the location is absolutely no recommendation. I'd rather pay a little more extra and be in the safe zone, I wouldn't take the bus here out on my own.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: IndiaKannan
Reviews.Content: I planned to go around Dubai, England, Scotland, France, Italy and Switzerland with my wife. I am 63 years of age and my wife 58. I started planning in February-March for a 45 days trip from 22nd April to 6th June 2010. In the month of March 2010 itself, we booked one double-bed room in Hotel Romulus, Via Salaria, 1069 00138 Roma, Italy. [-]; web:www.hotelromulus.com. Wherever we stayed during this trip, my criterion was to book a hotel as near to the Railway station or city-centre as possible. However, only in Roma, I let go this basic requirement. When I saw the photos of the rooms and hotel surroundings, I decided this would be the best choice. After a tiring day of visiting tourist attractions, one must have a nice place to retire – isn’t it? Yes, the hotel is about 12 kms from Roma Termini – the main Railway station. But the brochure assured excellent connectivity is available from the hotel. Later I found this to be true! Secondly, I got the best offer of Euro 44 per night for a double bed room. We reached Roma Termini on 22nd morning 1030 Hrs. from Paris by Train. Just before leaving Paris, I sent an email to Hotel Romuls to arrange for a taxi to pick us up, and within no time we got a reply confirming that a taxi would be waiting at the Railway station. She also informed that the driver will stand with a sign with my name on it at the meeting point. Later she gave another message indicating where exactly the driver would be standing, but unfortunately we had left Paris by that time and hence could not check that mail. At Roma Termini, we missed him and reached the hotel by another taxi. Though the taxi was deputed by the hotel and he was waiting in the station for some time, the hotel staff was considerate enough not to charge anything for that service. I read commentaries of tourists to Italy criticizing the cab drivers. But, our experience was a memorable one. We came across a very considerate, polite and friendly taxi driver who helped us load and unload our luggage and took a very resonable amount. Later we found that one can easily travel from Roma Termini to the hotel by train/bus even with luggage. From Roma Termini, go to Tiburtino FS by metro, come out of the station and walk across and catch bus No. 135. That is the starting point of Bus 135 and you have a bus every 20 minutes. The bus is very comfortable and you can get down just opposite to the hotel. Of course you have to climb a few steps to cross the road by pedestrian bridge. I feel the hotel must have clearly indicated this mode of transport in their website if a customer does not prefer to spend for taxi. The lounge was very impressive and the staff were friendly, ready with all info a tourist required. All of them speak English. She explained tourist attractions to be visited and the conveyance to be used with a map. She gave me another paper listing up and down timings of bus No. 135; and another brochure giving metro line routes with station names in blue and red lines. Another advantage was – there is a vending machine in the dining hall – insert a Euro and you get a ticket for using by any bus/metro upto next 75 minutes. There is also a 24 hr. coffee shop near the reception which is very useful. The rooms are very spacious and bath and WC are very good and clean. Surprisingly, they changed towels every day. We stayed 3 nights and undertook hectic visits to all the tourist attractions in Roma. I must say my stay in Hotel Romulus was a great help; because it hardly took 20 minutes to reach city centre; we used bus and metro with ease to go to Vatican, the farthest point from the hotel. Location of the hotel is a pollution free noiseless area and one can relax comfortably in the beautiful rooms. Only short-coming was dearth of restaurant arrangement in the hotel. No proper break-fast arrangement was available and for the dinner one has to order well in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Far from centre”
Reviews.Author: linajon
Reviews.Content: We did not stay in Romulus for very long. However, we are quite glad that it was only a short stay as it was awkward getting into the centre of Rome via the bus outside the hotel which did not follow the timetable set out and therefore was not always reliable. Once you got off the bus you had to take a metro into the centre to see the sights. Overall journey into say the Colosseum would take about an hour plus at times. There was not much around the hotel so to avoid the expensive dinners we stayed out in the centre until quite late and ate there. The hotel itself seemed nice enough. The staff were friendly and the rooms were cleaned (not thoroughly though) every day. We had breakfast included in our room deal but found it to be not that great. The croissants and bread were stale and the food tended to run out quickly so my tip would be to get there early. Other corners that were cut were the fact that our double room was made up of two single beds pushed together which made for an uncomfortable night if you fell across the gap. I would recommend this hotel for a cheap stay but be warned it is FAR FROM THE CENTRE and therefore not advisable if you'll be wanting to go sightseeing everyday

Reviews.Title: “Far away from everything, rude staff, shabby rooms”
Reviews.Author: cmac726
Reviews.Content: We were in the Hotel Romulus for two nights. The first night when we tried to find something to eat, the staff would only tell us that "Chef Oscar's meal" was available for the low price of 20 Euro. Chef Oscar's meal was a set menu--no menu choices available. We told the staff that 20 Euro was too expensive, and he reluctantly told us that there was a restaurant "several meters" down the road that we could walk to or there was a snack cart near. We chose the snack cart & had a great meal. We also had to pay a 10 Euro deposit for the remote to the television that the concierge didn't want to return when we returned the remote with the receipt. The hotel is very far from everything else. We had to take 2 buses and a train to get to the Colosseum. The rooms are of average quality, but one of my shoes went under the bed and when I pulled it out, it was covered in dust and hair. The bathrooms are very cramped and, again, there was dust and hair on the floor around the toilet and sink. If you can afford something better, do so!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katcha77
Reviews.Content: We stood in this hotel for four nights. We came at midnight and we haven´t any problem to accommodate. Reception worked 24/day. The stuff was pleasant and spoke English. This hotel is situated on the main road, but we didn´t hear any noise. Our room was easy arrangement and every day was cleaned. Beds were new and confortable. Bathroom was clean and nice. The price is fantastic. The yourney to the hotel is easy. You can take bus number 135 by the station Tiburtina. The stop is situated in front of the bus station Tiburtina. The yourney takes about 25 minutes and the bus stopped near the hotel, it goes every about 30 minutes to the midnight. We didn´t use to restaurant or any food, but thi offer was available. We were very satisfied and I can recommend Romulus hotel to my friends. Kateřina Vyroubalová, The Czech rep.

Reviews.Title: “far from everything,very noisy”
Reviews.Author: adonis132
Reviews.Content: this hotel is just a fancy side road hotel.you have just one bus line 2m walking from the hotel that takes 20m to tiburtina station..the problem is the bus comes always out of the schedule....we stayed in the room 203..it was old and very noisy because of the freeway and the train line in front of the hotel.the room wasn´t so clean.....the towels were changed every day but the bed clothes not, even when we asked for....the internet in the room was really bad...the bathroom was small and dirty....for young couples or friend groups looking for low costs holidays it´s not bad.....

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant 7-day stay”
Reviews.Author: mikhail90
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Rome with our 3-year-old daughter, around Easter hoilday. We stayed in the hotel Romulus. We booked the whole trip with lastminute.com. There is a good bus service: it takes about 25 minutes to get to Rome. The bus is regular, about every 30 minutes. The hotel staff is pleasant and friendly. The hotel is clean. There is an option to have an American or an Italian breakfast. In order to travel around Rome you can buy a travel card (metro+bus+tram), which is 4 euros for one day or 16 euros for 7 days. The bus final stop is at Tiburtina station, which has a left-luggage office and a train connection to Fiumicino Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: maximuss74
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel from 25.12.2009 to 31.12.2009. Everything was very nice, room was clean,many towels in a bathroom, very nice furniture, cleaning was O.K. Bus stop located just in a few meters froma hotel. Receptionist Francesca was very helpful and kindly. If I will decide to come in Rome next time , I will choose this hotel again. Maxim, St. Petersburg, Russia.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: laradorren
Reviews.Content: Very nice budget hotel. Rooms were cleaned everyday, we had window view on some fields (a lot of green). The restaurant was closed for renovation so I can't tell you anything about it's quality but breakfasts were ok. Staff was friendly. Don't forget to ask about TV remote control in the reception desk (you'll get it after leaving repayable deposit - 10euro) Tip: The best way to get there from the airport is to reach TIBURTINA station (from Fiumicino - fr1 in the direction Orte) and then take 135 bus directly to the hotel (the trip takes round 25min and buses are every 30mins - it is the first bus stop of line 135 so you can wait inside the bus when it arrives). At Tiburtina you have also Metro station from where you can get to all Rome sights.

Reviews.Title: “Far from everything”
Reviews.Author: errada
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very comfortable and the room was amazing, but there isn't anything, really, anything at all around the hotel. It's a fancy roadside hotel. There was only one bus line we could get to go to Rome, but if you have a car I think it would be ok. The restaurant was closed while we where there, so they had these daily shuttles to another nearby restaurant. There weren't many options. Breakfast was fair for 10 euros. Free wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby and too far from the centre”
Reviews.Author: Nano81
Reviews.Content: You can get a very better place to stay if you want to visit Rome. Don't choose this hotel: it's uncomfortable, not very clean and the worst thing is that it is miles away from the centre of Rome. The only bus that stops near the hotel passes every 30 minutes (if you're lucky) and on sunday every hour. This bus takes you at the closest underground station after an at least 30 minutes trip. Then, you have to take the tube if you want to get the centre.. Too much if you want to save time and spend it in the best way. The hotel is old fashioned and shabby... I want to forget it!

Reviews.Title: “A peculiar hotel in an eerie place”
Reviews.Author: Vannegen
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel just for one night because of its bargain price. Was it worth it? - Maybe... First, it is not easy to reach the hotel if you come by train (FR1). Possibly we got something wrong and it was our fault, but our way to the hotel was a real ordeal. It is located at one of the major busy streets and it seems the only reasonable way to reach it is by bus coming from Piazza Tiburtina, or by a hotel free shuttle, if you're lucky enough to run across it. The hotel itself is a Sowjet-type of building. It looks peculiar but acceptable, just only if you face its main entrance. From the back (to see it you have to venture a walk towards the former sport facilities, now an abandoned bush-ridden area behind it) it just looks like a run-down prison. The area it is in is a mixture of old office or warehouse buildings and some undefined green area, that might have once been nice, but now conveys a sense of downfall and a weird in-the-middle-of-nowhere spot. The hotels interior is surprisingly nice, so are the rooms: slightly outdated, but in some old Italian style. A remarkable plus of the hotel is the breakfast: a wide selection of food, incl. fruit, cakes etc. In total, this hotel might be a good choice, if you're in Rome by car or you do not mind long travel to the city center (apart from the distance, it's a matter of traffic jams!). If you plan a longer stay to see Rome and/or are after some romantic getaway, you might be better off looking for some other place.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain Price - But at a cost...”
Reviews.Author: Dan_t4
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I booked a trip to Rome to mark our 2 year anniversary and decided to book our flights and hotel separately. I read some reviews before booking this Hotel and saw some of the nightmare stories from 2007 but saw that most recent ones seemed to be ok, and this coupled with the price (£187 for 5 nights!) appeared perfect. I will go through the up's and downs of this place step by step.. Location - This Hotel is miles away from Rome! There is a bus stop close to the Hotel, and the bus comes every 30 minutes(ish) and every hour on Sundays and this is about a 30 minute ride to the nearest metro which is Tiburtina FS which is still about a 20 minute Metro ride to the centre of Rome. It is too far away to return to after a day of sight seeing to then get changed and go out again, so we ended up staying out all day and returning late at night. Transport - DO NOT TAKE THE BUS AT NIGHT!! When returning to the hotel from the Metro station it is again a 30 minute ride, but it is more like a tour of some sort of sub-culture after about 9pm and i would not recommend this to anyone. A taxi from the station to the hotel costs around 15 Euro. Area - The Hotel boasts the fact it is 48 meters from a bus stop, but sadly at night there are a string of Hookers that are much much closer all along the Via Salaria. When night falls they all come out and stand near to the footbridge that you have to cross if you want to get a bus. Again after dark, a strange sort of food van appears in the car park next to the hotel where old men gather and talk very loudly into the night - possibly the pimps. Staff - The staff at the hotel are friendly and helpful and were very understanding when my girlfriend fell ill over some bad food we had eaten in the city. Always appeared smart and proffesional. Rooms - The rooms are basic and dated to say the least. They are not the most comfortable places on earth, but they are adequate. The TV is not worth turning on, and the telephone is straight out of the 80's. There is no literature in the room at all, so have your guide book with you if your looking for inspiration. Our room was at the front of the hotel and was extremely noisy at night due to the fact there was a main road right outside and constant Ambulance Sirens. The Train line runs across the road and they run until about 01.00 hours so be prepared to be woken up until then. As I said earlier, the food van and old men gather into the night and can be very noisy. Our room had AC but it was not particularly noticable and it was still very hot in our room at the end of the day. Cleaning - The rooms are serviced daily and are kept clean. For some reason our towels always smelt like Salt and Vinegar crisps?! which was very strange! The bathroom is dated and the shower in in the bath running off of the taps. Overall the standard of clenliness is good. Food - We did not eat at the hotel, but got the odd can of overpriced coke (as is everywhere in Rome). In Conclusion - This Hotel is seriously Budget. The area is awful after dark and it is at least an Hour away before you actually get to the bits of Rome you want to see. In my opinion, it would be well worth paying a little extra to stay somewhere more romantic and closer to the city and i wish i had! The Staff seem to make the best of what they have (which isn't much) and The Hotel is a place to sleep and not much else. I Will not be going back to Hotel Romulus.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel, excellent staff, great food, neat room and a wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: priya2009
Reviews.Content: We were in rome mid june 2009, and stayed at romulus for three nights and four days. We were so thrilled so notice the 1st class service, the staff was extremely helpful and polite and not to forget, i would seperately want to mention the name- Antonio at the reception desk was more than helpful and friendly!! thanks!! and the rooms were brilliant and to our surprise we were given a free upgrade to a bigger room and offered a bottle of wine.... though we never asked for al lthis, its conviently located, it might take you 40 min in total to reach the main tourist attraction but very easily located and from the other side of the road you can see hotel romulus so clearly that even if we reached rome at 12 in night, we were glad to find it 3 min walk from the bus stop!! there cant be anything better than this hotel in rome!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, clean, friendly staff...a bargain price.”
Reviews.Author: BarcelonaGrammie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really good, especially for the price. It is a bit far from the center of Rome but they offer a free shuttle into town. Or if you have a car, enjoy the Roman driving and go for it! As others have said, it isn't it the nicest area of town, but it's really not bad, either. I recommend Hotel Romulus!

Reviews.Title: “utterly brilliant”
Reviews.Author: rosepetalDoncaster
Reviews.Content: we found everything from the location ,to the very professional and friendly care and attention given by all the staff from arriving to departing made us feel welcome and glad to be in such a lovely hotel this was futher improved by the one EURO bus ride into central Rome

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Romulus Hotel - budget Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: greentravellercanada
Reviews.Content: Romulus Hotel seemed too good to be true- and it was. At 36 euros a night for a 3 star, we thought we'd struck gold. Cheap it is, but 3 star- questionable. The main problem with this hotel is its profound bleakness. An oddly Soviet exterior- a character-less block- inside, its lobby, hallways and rooms emit a wave of depression. We observed other disconcerted tourists on a budget whispering outside the doors, but alas, the policy is strictly no refunds/no cancellations. Sitting outside the highway, its in a dismal industrial area with prostitutes on ever corner and absolutely nothing around- no restaurants, shops, grocery, etc, but a quick bus route into Rome, which is convenient. It was somewhat misadvertised, the website stating there is a lovely garden and good restaurant, as well as an airport shuttle (no shuttle). Our window opens onto an empty lot with junk strewn about. The rooms are awfully decorated. It is cheap, it's not too far outside of Rome but even spending as little time as possible in the hotel, in the end, the savings didn't make up for the depressing atmosphere of the place. If we had spent our whole trip staying in this hotel, it would have ruined it.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, ripped off without even staying at this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: mikepilar
Reviews.Content: After making reservations online for this hotel, the next day, our reservations were cancelled with the explanation that there are no rooms for the dates we wanted to stay. Ok, no problem, make reservations at another hotel....however, 3 days later, a charge for 250 euros appears on our card with an email that a mistake was made and in fact rooms are available and now a brand new non-refundable reservation has been confirmed. So, after cancelling our initial reservations and admitting to it, the hotel STOLE 250 euros from our bank account and made brand new reservations for us. USE EXTREME CAUTION IF YOU WISH TO STAY HERE AS THEY ARE THIEVES!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel with friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Thurry
Reviews.Content: Reception staff was very friendly, always quickly available, and could help us out on our queries. The bar was open late at night, allowing us to take a night cap. Although hotel is at outskirts of Rome, transport to and from the center was easy through either bus - stops just aside the hotel - or using the free hotel shuttle. The room + bathroom was very clean and had good working airco. The blinds did not go up the first day, but was immediately fixed after we informed reception!. I would use the hotel again if I would go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “I am not related in any way to The Owners of Hotel Romulus”
Reviews.Author: wellsick
Reviews.Content: I booked this before reading the reviews, then I read them and thought OMG!! what have I done? However we were pleasantly surprised. It was a reasonable price compared to city centre hotel prices, beware Brits, Rome is very expensive (more later) Getting there from the City Centre is easy, metro's every 2 or 3 minutes to Tiburtini which takes 10 minutes max, then a 20 minute bus ride, buses every 15 minutes. This did not bother us as I used to have a 40 minute bus ride every day to work so I noticed nothing different and after 3 days we were totally used to the travelling. I think they have cleaned up the area as there were no hookers and pickpockets whatsoever in evidence, again if you have been near certain parts of Tyneside, the outskirts of Rome are like the Cotswolds in comparison. so travelling to and from the hotel was nothing different to travelling in any city suburb and even better there is a shuttle bus from the hotel to the metro every day at various times.. The receptionists at the hotel were incredibly helpful, the barman a great bloke and drinks at the bar were half the price of drinks in Rome centre which saved us quite alot. The restaurant was quite good but we only went once as they did'nt do pizzas! but it was nice enough. There is also free wi fi and a free computer with internet access at the hotel which was ideal for keeping tabs on my ebay and emails and again saved us a packet not having to use internet cafes. Rooms were clean and fine for the job, breakfast was traditional Italian (basic) nice bread and butter but then lots of jam etc and sweet croisants, cereals but no cheese, ham, eggs etc. So there you are nowhere near as bad as it sounds, clean, cheap drinks and great value. Rome is fantastic no doubt about it but very expensive, 6 quid a pint, 5 quid a glass of wine in any bar whether scruffy backstreet or prime position in a piazza. Only good value food at night is pizza, pasta seem cheap but you don't get much as it is a prima platte (starter), ministrone soup 6 or 7 quid a bowl, bruschetta 3 quid, (a thin piece of toast with chopped tomato and a pinch of oregano on it) But at lunchtime there are loads of offers, best we found was El Borracho near Campo di Fiori, fochetta's or Pannini's with any filling plus a beer for 3 quid. Best pizzas we found were at 'Wanted' and ' Vechia Roma' both on Via Leonina in the Cavour area where there are loads of other places also at half reasonable prices. I'm on a roll now, book online for the Vatican museums or face a 2 hour queqe, go to the Forum first and get a combined ticket for the Forum and Collaseum otherwise a 2 hour queque at the Colluseum and if you still have a teacher union card or GTC card take it and you will get 3 euros off. Most arty places you have to pay for which is a bit of a culture shock for those of us used to free London Museums. Thats it, have fun. Signed: Mr Positive.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Of Horrors”
Reviews.Author: quala
Reviews.Content: Hi to all who intend to stay at the Romulus, I agree with all the above comments regarding this Hotel. We could have kicked ourselves for not looking at this web page before going to Rome.The Hotel was miles away from the centre and the journey into the centre took forever between dodging traffic and prostitutes. Service was diabolical as we ate in the restuarant on one occassion and all our dishes arrive at the table at the same time. The Hotel also claimed to have luxurious gardens and when we requested to use the garden we were refused and the receptionist would not explain why. But the main comment I have is to be very careful on the metro as I was pickpocketed just as I was boarding the train. I am convinced that there was one accomplice in front of me and this held me up for a few seconds while the other stole the money that was in my back pocket.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay There - You Have Been Warned!”
Reviews.Author: alvinne
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from 4 days as sight seeing tourists. If you are like us DO NOT STAY THERE. it is a contractors/worker hotel for employees who are sent to Rome to carry out tasks. In this respect it is ok notwithstanding a dire dining room and staff. (Mrs Overall <Acorn Antiques> is alive and well and working here!) As a tourist hotel it is useless. 10k and a bus+metro ride from Rome. You will also run the gauntlet of prostitutes and their tools of the trade! on the flyover from the bus stop. Rooms and rception staff were fine and the hotel is well appointed. But do not trust the dining room - you have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Miles away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I agree with the previous review. There is a bus stop down the road into the bus terminal, but you have to stand on the main road which is well risky as the traffic just flies past, the bus takes you about an hour, then from that bus terminal a train into the centre which is another half hour into the main termini. This hotel is miles away from the centre of Rome. And there are prostitutes plying their trade just down from the hotel every evening. Breakfast is a dry bun and dinner is a very small menu. At dinner i was the only girl in the restaurant which is a bit disconcerting. I generally get the feeling that this hotel is a "gentlemens" hotel. The ice machine was broken also. Considering this place is supposed to be 3* i was dissapointed, the pink padded walls in the room were really outdated, the bedroom furniture had no handles on it either. The only thing i will say is that it is really clean. This hotel needs to get a shuttle bus big time - never again, thinking i was saving on a cheaper hotel, i made up for it in transport - pants!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Romulus
HotelInfo.Address: Via Salaria, 1069, 00138 Rome, Italy
